Issues.Title: ListView Visibility Bug
Issues.Body:
## Note:

Here is a sample project I created that demonstrates this behavior (same one I used in the below GIF): https://github.com/MemeMachineSO/WpfProblem

## The Problem:

I have a TabView which has a DataTemplate for each page. This template contains two ListViews, one for drives and one for files and folders. The reason I designed it this way is that drives and files/folders require different columns, and you can not change column visibility for a ListView. The closest you can do is making the column really small, which is not a good solution as the user can still resize the column.

Anyways, when the user clicks on a drive and browses it, the DrivesListView has a DataTrigger for a bool called `DrivesListViewEnabled` which will be switched to false. This should in theory hide the drives ListView, revealing the listview under it for files and folders. The problem is this does not actually occur, and the DrivesListView is still at the front, blocking the FileFoldersListView below. **However, if I open a new tab and switch back the affected tab, the `DrivesListView` is now suddenly hidden as it should be.** I am unsure what could be causing this behavior. Perhaps it refreshes something when I switch back and forth between tabs?

## A GIF of the Problem:

[![enter image description here][1]][1]

The same issue happens when I browse out from the root of a drive. It should hide the FileFoldersListView and display the DrivesListView, but this does not happen unless I switch back and forth from another tab.

I am making sure to use NotifyPropertyChanged and an ObservableCollection to ensure updates happen. I've tweaked the XAML countless times as well. 

I also tried using a BooleanToVisibilityConverter instead of a DataTrigger. This did not help.

What could be causing this to happen?

[1]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/rJogr.gif
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ListView Visibility Bug" (#6909)

Issues.Title: When the Storyboard in VisualTransition of ControlTemplate selects the same property as the Storyboard in VisualState, it will cause a memory leak, and the Storyboard in VisualTransition will not be released
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .net 6.o
* Windows version: win10 64bit 21H1
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)?No
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:When the Storyboard in VisualTransition of ControlTemplate selects the same property as the Storyboard in VisualState, it will cause a memory leak, and the Storyboard in VisualTransition will not be released.
I tried with the same code in .net 6 and .net framework 4.8, both result in memory leak.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "When the Storyboard in VisualTransition of ControlTemplate selects the same property as the Storyboard in VisualState, it will cause a memory leak, and the Storyboard in VisualTransition will not be released" (#6898)

Issues.Title: Border color does not change in Windows 11.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: NET 6
* Windows version: Windows 11
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes

The Main Window border color does not change in Windows 11.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52397976/184502260-bbb23dcb-2163-4709-b5f1-fade694fc71b.png)


However, I confirmed that the color can be changed through a program such as a visual studio.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52397976/184502239-a00d23eb-695b-4059-a668-04041697ca64.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Border color does not change in Windows 11." (#6896)

Issues.Title: Replace resource constants with properties in PresentationUI
Issues.Body:
Contributes to dotnet/wpf#1

## Description
Replace the use of resource constants with properties in PresentationUI. This follows the standard of other .Net projects, like [dotnet/runtime](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime).

## Customer Impact
None.

## Regression
No.

## Testing
Local build + CI.

## Risk
None.
